data.title: A little overpriced
data.text: Not very big and a little overpriced, but plenty of  choices for ice cream, hot beverages, chocolates, and treats.  Perfect location to sit outside and enjoy the sights.

data.title: Sweet Tooth Satisfaction
data.text: Ice cream, candies, cakes and more...even a sugar free selection! Scenic center of town. Great place to stroll with a cone!

data.title: After dinner dessert
data.text: Stopped in for cheesecake and coffee.  The food is excellent as you can buy dessert by the slice.  The cafe also offers ice cream and other treats.  Service was good.  Located right in the heart of downtown Indy.

data.title: Y
data.text: This place was pretty nice.  Had a variety for all budgets. Had chocolates and a little ice cream shop and a little cafe to eat your treats

data.title: Sweets Delight
data.text: Everything is great here except for the inside appearance and cleanliness which is an easy fix. Definitely worth a stop in. I'm yet to try the hot chocolate which I heard is divine but as far as the ice cream, chocolate and service, they get a thumbs up from me! Just thinking about this store is making my mouth water, well.. guess I have to head down there now.

data.title: Typical Chocolate Store
data.text: Stopped in here on a busy Saturday night after a carriage ride on the circle. For being so busy the line moved fast and they were open until midnight. Friendly service, must try the chocolate and creme cake. Reminded me of the ice cream cake rolls we used to get when we were kids!

data.title: Yum!
data.text:
The candy is amazing...so is the ice cream!  A special treat is the hot cherry cordial beverage on a cool evening!

Great location for visiting with friends or people watching!

data.title: Make time to stop by.
data.text: Located right in the center of town, this is definitely worth a stop.  They coffee is delicious, they said the hot chocolate is the best anywhere - and they're right.  We had delicious muffins and went back later for ice cream.  The staff were all friendly, helpful and available.

data.title: Visited twice in 2 days!
data.text:
I was staying in the area for work meetings and wanted something sweet.  I got the white and chocolate mousse cake.  It was delicious!  I sent my hubby a picture of the six layer chocolate cake, to which he sent me back the next day to get for him.

Very good!

data.title: We Bring All Visitors To Indianapolis Here! Always! The place to go for great Hot Cocoa
data.text: We really and truly bring everyone here when they visit Indy. This is the BEST HOT CHOCOLATE ever!!! You must order the Dark Hot Chocolate. It is mixed with South Bend melted chocolate and topped with a cherry and chocolate drizzled. It is the best thing in winter: grab a hot chocolate and walk around the circle enjoying the lights, the sounds and the people while the hot cocoa warms you up!!!

data.title: Great variety
data.text: I was visiting & this shop is steps from my hotel.  They have many varieties of chocolates in all price ranges.  I bought my hubby chocolate covered almonds & he loved them!

data.title: Milk shakes and more
data.text: I can only really comment on the milk shakes and malts. That's what I love. Great motorcycle destination on the circle on weekends. Milk shakes in malts in any flavor. From vanilla to mint chocolate chip, you can't go wrong. I see lots of folks buying and eating their candy....so it must be good!

data.title: Consistently good
data.text: Chocolate treats made in-store, and in small batches mean you get high-quality treats at reasonable prices, so you can share or bring some home!

data.title: Quick coffee stop!
data.text:
We were enjoying the monument and when we got out we smelled the wonderful scent of great coffee.
We got a couple of hot coffees to go and a couple of sea salt caramels...... so very yummy.

Quick and easy stop!

data.title: You Know You Want To!
data.text: The first day I saw this place, I knew I had to get SOMETHING!  But I was trying to eat healthy so I got the fruit plate, thinking fruit and dark chocolate wouldn't be so bad.  Except I didn't know they would pile half a can of whipped cream on it.  If getting again I would ask for no whipped cream, but either way it's delicious if that's your thing. The second day I brought a friend willing to share a piece of the HUGE 6 layer chocolate cake and we couldn't manage to get through the whole thing.  They were kind enough to box up the leftover and even drizzled more chocolate on it.  If you order the cake, make sure it's relatively new and the cut sides have the parchment paper on it in the glass case.  Nothing would be sadder than stale cake.  This place has indoor and outdoor seating including a little fire pit in the middle of the table outside.  Great spot for people watching.

data.title: homemade chocolates at a reasonable price
data.text: We stopped in to the chocolate store about 15  minutes before closing.  The staff was still helpful and pleasant.  You can purchase something as simple as a chocolate bar made by South Bend Chocolates or very fancy individual chocolates.  We chose 6 of the individual ones out of the case.  Our choices included a dark and milk chocolate covered cherry, key lime dark chocolate and orange milk chocolate truffle.  There are many more exotic things to pick from.   There were fancy Easter candies available as well.  There is also a small cafe with ice cream and coffee.  Our chocolates were put in individual wrappers and put in a small gold box.  They would make a wonderful gift - but we ate them!  Average price was $1 a piece for what we got.

data.title: Ummm...NO
data.text:
We visited for a quick sweet treat.   What a disappointment.   Our cake slice was old and stale,
Our latte was cold, and the "world famous" hot chocolate was mediocre at best.   My son said his brownie was good, but he said it was like the ones I bake at home
Just don't ask for the bathroom~ you have to give an ID and ride a smelly freight  elevator to the basement.  Yuck

data.title: Great Cup of Hot Cocoa
data.text: Stopped in for coffee and a cup of hot chocolate. Got the white chocolate...yum-o! They also sell popcorn, candies, and other delicious treats. Indoor and outdoor seating was available.

data.title: Great hot chocolate
data.text: Stopped in while touring Indy - had the dark hot chocolate.  It was delicious!  Others in my group had the frozen yogurt, hot chocolate and pumpkin covered pretzels (also delicious).  They have booths in the back and stools up front - it was a chilly, rainy day and this was a great place to take a break

data.title: Wonderful place, great hot chocolate
data.text: Love, love, love their hot chocolate. That's all I've ever had when visiting. We go here after attending the symphony sometimes but always after the Yuletide Celebration. The Cherry Hot Chocolate is like drinking a decadent gourmet chocolate covered cherry! And the folks are a lot of fun!
